Economic Left/Right: 5.32
 Social Libertarian/Authoritarian: -.72 I am Milton Friedman
 
 I was not surprised by the left/right equation but I was indeed interested to find myself right on the line between libertarian/authoritarian. I really don't feel all that moderate at all. 
 
 Perhaps as a time saving measure in future debates we could simply post our numbers rather than lengthy diatribes. It would save a hell of a lot of time:

electrolyte
This says I'm pretty much smack dab in the middle of quadrant III, "Libertarian Left," even though I'm not at all what I'd call a libertarian. I am closest to Gandhi and the Dalai Lama.
jyoshu

Two problems ...
 
 - Every question needs a "neutral" available. I found several that I didn't find myself agreeing OR disagreeing on. They are all worded in such a way that forces a choice even if one doesn't fall either way on something.
 
 - Every question needs a "N/A" available. For instance, one question says "Because corporations cannot be trusted to voluntarily protect the environment, they require regulation", but what if the reader doesn't agree that with even the conditional premise that corporations can't be trusted? It becomes a sort of "do-you-still-beat-your-wife" type of question.
Matthew S

For instance, one question says "Because corporations cannot be trusted to voluntarily protect the environment, they require regulation", but what if the reader doesn't agree that with even the conditional premise that corporations can't be trusted? It becomes a sort of "do-you-still-beat-your-wife" type of question.

 
 I think that question is a yes or no, agree strongly or disagree strongly.

This says I'm pretty much smack dab in the middle of quadrant III, "Libertarian Left," even though I'm not at all what I'd call a libertarian. I am closest to Gandhi and the Dalai Lama.

 
 It isn't libertarian in the political party sense. It is libertarian in the social freedom sense. The lower to the bottom you are the more you believe in personal freedom and choice.
Zardoz

Economic Left/Right: -4.75
 Social Libertarian/Authoritarian: -1.85 
 
 
 Last time I took it a few years back, was around -2 eco and around +1 lib/auth.
 
 Getting a tad bit more 'liberal' according to this test.
 
 But, I also agree, some of the questions force you to a position you really don't have much concern about.
 A simply number assignment from 1 to 9 or so would work better and give a sligthly more accurate reading IMO. 
 
 But, basically, I just don't trust big businesses as having the best interest of the consumer or pretty much anything in the short term and resisting such pushes by the consumer in the long term. Some nich businesses that cater to custermer desires are also not the best.
 And that's even respecting the businesses (and peoples) right to seek profit and success. 
 Must be the economy bringing me down. I hate covering the business news at work and I'd love to sell the house, but not in this market...
 
 And while I see a gov't as needed at times to ensure people are protected from predatory practices and harm as well as ensuring the free flow of traffic, goods and services to it's people, I think most people should be left alone to their own pursuits.
 
 *shrug*
 
 I see some of the posters here are communo-anarchists intent on tearing the 'stablishment down with their bare paws.
 Roar!
Phunting

For instance, one question says "Because corporations cannot be trusted to voluntarily protect the environment, they require regulation", but what if the reader doesn't agree that with even the conditional premise that corporations can't be trusted? It becomes a sort of "do-you-still-beat-your-wife" type of question.
Then you disagree with the statement, so should put 'disagree'.
 
 I do agree it is somewhat flawed though, as I tend to be quite authoritarian on issues such as crime, national security, the military and gun control and quite libertarian on issues such as religion, homosexuality, immigration and drugs which tends to average me out in the middle, which isn't really at all accurate.
 
 For the record I was:
 
 Economic Left/Right: -6.75
 Social Libertarian/Authoritarian: -1.49 
 
 Which is fractionally more left wing than before...
 
 I personally prefer the 3D version described here:
 
 http://www.friesian.com/quiz.htm
 
 Which differentiates between 'personal' and 'political' libertarianism, which would chart me as personally libertarian, politically authoritarian and economically liberal.
